{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3480344,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T21:16:27.238Z","cooked":"

We have SPARK MAXs with NEOs on our robot.

After updating the REV hardware client to 1.7.0 (from Beta) and flashing 25.0.1 firmware, I cannot see the option under RUN that allows me to run the motor.
It does not work programmatically via Java code either (and everything is updated to the right API versions).

Any suggestions what can be checked? Anyone has NEOs/SparkMAX running after all the release updates?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T21:16:27.238Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":37,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":208.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481275,"topic_slug":"rev-hardware-client-cannot-run-motors","display_username":"Alex Tsekhansky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50762,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-hardware-client-cannot-run-motors/481275/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3480383,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T21:58:11.196Z","cooked":"

As an update - clear/reset/resave of the firmware programmatically via Java makes REV working again from code.

That still leaves a question - is there an option to control SPARKMAX from REV hardware client, like run it with, say 0.3 duty cycle, or a specific voltage?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T21:58:11.196Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":31.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":481275,"topic_slug":"rev-hardware-client-cannot-run-motors","display_username":"Alex Tsekhansky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50762,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-hardware-client-cannot-run-motors/481275/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480386,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T22:03:05.770Z","cooked":"
atsekhan:

That still leaves a question - is there an option to control SPARKMAX from REV hardware client, like run it with, say 0.3 duty cycle, or a specific voltage?

I believe the REV Hardware Client will not let you control the motors if the CAN bus on the roboRIO is active. You could disconnect the individual motors you want to run from the CAN bus first and try again with the REV Hardware Client.
